intro: Sideritis catalaunica, commonly known as the Catalaunian ironwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pale blue or violet flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sideritis catalaunica is often found in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
